sentences.english: His pale lined face and luxuriant flowing hair.
sentences.chinese: 他那苍白而布有皱纹的面孔和浓密而飘拂的头发。

sentences.english: Her dark hair waved untidy across her broad forehead.
sentences.chinese: 她的黑发散乱地飘拂在宽阔的脑门子上。

sentences.english: She wrapped her flowing robes about her and turned away from her mother.
sentences.chinese: 她裹上飘拂的长袍，转身背对著自己的母亲。

sentences.english: I am like a remnant of a cloud of autumn uselessly roaming in the sky.
sentences.chinese: 我就像秋天里的一片残云，无助地飘拂在空中。

sentences.english: I ascend, I float in the regions of your love O man.
sentences.chinese: 我凌空飞升，我飘拂在你那爱的疆域，啊，男人。

definition: (of a breeze) to make (hair, leaves, clothing etc) sway gently/to ruffle
to fly up/to dance in the air (of snowflakes, flower petals etc)
to sway gently (as in the wind)/(of a flame) to flicker
to dance/to float in the wind
to drift/to wave/to float on the waves/to flutter in the wind
to float in the air/swiftly/nimbly/easy and relaxed
intermittent/now you see it, now you don't
